CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 17, 1955, pg. A29, reads: "Pittsburgh's Story - Junior high school pupils Jerry Yee, of Fifth Avenue High School; Doris Zelmenovitz, of Allderdice; Gerald Rhodes, of Letsche, and Gilbert Exler, of Arsenal High School, were all winners in B'nai B'rith Art Contest displayed Monday at the Board of Education in Oakland. Their paintings are typical of those of other pupils who under the supervision of art instructors sketched and painted Pittsburgh's Renaissance in the theme of "Together We Build the New Pittsburgh." Rhodes exhibit received special praise. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of students Jerry Yee, Doris Zelmenovitz, Gerald Rhodes, and Gilbert Exler, holding winning artwork in the B'nai B'rith Art Contest, posed in room of the Board of Education, Oakland
